featured.text: Brazil’s Environmental Ministry estimates that in 1970, 99 percent of the original Amazon Rainforest remained, but in 2000, only 85 percent.
The following is a report by one of the team members: “I watched a small piece of the Amazon Rainforest disappear today.
The heart of this continent is the Amazon Rainforest, a vast paradise watered by one of the world’s greatest rivers.
A team of scientists, teachers, and students, the AmazonQuest team, recently explored some of the wonders of the Amazon Rainforest.
It is estimated that more than 33 million acres of Amazonian Rainforest disappear every year.

other.text: (4) Between 1970 and 2000, what percentage of the original Amazon Rainforest was cut down?

definition.zh_def: 熱帶雨林，指位於赤道附近的潮濕森林，擁有豐富的生物多樣性和高降雨量。
definition.en_def: A rainforest is a dense forest found in tropical areas with high rainfall and a wide variety of plant and animal species.
definition.example: The Amazon rainforest is home to countless species of plants and animals.
